ygData.messageBody:
Wrong idea...YOu are saying to allow the wizard to be able to SOLO
better. Again, this is not SoloQUEST (although its not really Quest
anything yet with alot of quests broken).

Tanks have same trouble with even fights sometimes...I play a tank and
a wizard. The tank is easy at low levels, but I remember taking on 3
black wolves and two orc pawns all at once with my wizard...he killed
thma all and begged for more.

--- Gooey Smalls <smullins@...> wrote:
> From: "Gooey Smalls" <smullins@...>
>
> I gave up my wizard quite some time ago, they really
> are quite weak, only
> good for two things, grouping and stealing kills.
> What do other spell
> casting classes have that we lack? Pets of course.
> The steel skin, leather
> skin line of spells should be altered in such a way
> that wizards from low
> lvl's (perhaps 8) can summon a sort of wall. This
> wall would be sort of
> like a pet (graphically how it would show does'nt
> concern me) but without
> offensive capabilities, it would simply soak damage
> and allow a wizard to
> not be interrupted. For example, wizard A wants to
> solo an even fight orc,
> so he summons his wall of whatever, that soaks 50
> damage without the wizard
> actually being hit, the wizard can skip the risky
> root opening shot and get
> right to damage. This would put wizards on an even
> playing field with other
> magic classes, they NEVER root for their opening
> shot, that's what their
> pets are for, we should'nt have to rely on root
> either, we need something
> more definite like this wall idea. It's the only
> thing that would get me to
> play the wizard class again.
>
>
